intro: Chusquea longiprophylla, commonly known as the long-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of fern ally native to South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and creeping growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically found on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
